<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 355, 390, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 384, 399, 399]]<|/det|>
You will need: Geometrical instruments  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 221, 432]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 434, 805, 574]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- Calculators must not be used in this paper.- You may use tracing paper.- You must show all necessary working clearly.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 602, 212, 616]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 618, 728, 650]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 100.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 72, 567, 87]]<|/det|>
List of formulas 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 115, 680, 142]]<|/det|>
Area, \(A\), of triangle, base \(b\), height \(h\). \(A = \frac{1}{2} bh\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 168, 675, 186]]<|/det|>
Area, \(A\), of circle of radius \(r\). \(A = \pi r^2\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 216, 675, 234]]<|/det|>
Circumference, \(C\), of circle of radius \(r\). \(C = 2\pi r\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 263, 685, 281]]<|/det|>
Curved surface area, \(A\), of cylinder of radius \(r\), height \(h\). \(A = 2\pi rh\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 310, 670, 328]]<|/det|>
Curved surface area, \(A\), of cone of radius \(r\), sloping edge \(l\). \(A = \pi rl\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 358, 685, 376]]<|/det|>
Surface area, \(A\), of sphere of radius \(r\). \(A = 4\pi r^2\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 408, 663, 426]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of prism, cross-sectional area \(A\), length \(l\). \(V = Al\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 450, 680, 481]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of pyramid, base area \(A\), height \(h\). \(V = \frac{1}{3} Ah\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 505, 680, 523]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of cylinder of radius \(r\), height \(h\). \(V = \pi r^2 h\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 552, 692, 579]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of cone of radius \(r\), height \(h\). \(V = \frac{1}{3} \pi r^2 h\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 600, 685, 626]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of sphere of radius \(r\). \(V = \frac{4}{3} \pi r^3\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 644, 772, 675]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(ax^2 + bx + c = 0\), where \(a \neq 0\), \(x = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a}\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 700, 265, 715]]<|/det|>
For the triangle shown, 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 746, 796, 870]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{align*}
\frac{a}{\sin A} &= \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C} \\
a^2 &= b^2 + c^2 - 2bc \cos A \\
\text{Area} &= \frac{1}{2} ab \sin C
\end{align*}
\]
